intro: Stixis balansae, commonly known as the Balansae mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and white, fleshy berries. The plant lacks true roots and absorbs water and nutrients through its haustoria, which penetrate the host's vascular system. It is native to certain regions of South America and is often found in humid, forested areas. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant ecological impacts on its host species.
